titleStmt.title: Archieratikon, Add. MS 16373, The British Library, 1706
titleStmt.author: Dilyana Radoslavova

sourceDesc.p: This description is based on de visu observations and on the published catalogue descriptions Cleminson 1988: 70-72. Стефановић 1984-85: 60-62

prefixDef.p: In the context of this project, private URIs with the prefix "bib" point to bibl elements in the project's bib.xml file.

revisionDesc.change: Addition of notBefore and notAfter attributes in element <origDate>
Removed entities for the basic Old Slavic characters
The description of notes moved into "additions"

support.material: Paper, thick and highly glazed; the last gathering appears to be of a different though similar paper

collation.signatures: Gatherings II-XXI are signed in the middle of the lower margin, first recto and last verso, with Cyrillic letters а҃-к҃

physDesc.ink: Black; red, and occasionally (f. 1v) green, for titles, initials and rubrics. Blue, yellow and gold are used for the decoration

decoDesc.decoNote: Rich, with full-page miniatures and ornamented headpieces and initials; gold, yellow, silver, blue, red and grey palette
Of mediocre quality, characteristic for the late South Slavonic illumination; the linear drawings are coloured by evenly laid paint

F. 2v:St. John Chrysostomos, in full length, under an arch, blessing, with a codex in his left hand. The image is copied from the Liturgicon of Michail Sljozka, printed in Lviv in 1646 (Петковић 2002: 404). The arch is decorated with floral and animal patterns. In blue, red, yellow and gold. Within a simple red frame ( 160 95 ), with floral motifs in the inner side of each of the bottom corners.

f. 57v: A full-page miniature of St. John Chrysostomos being ordained by St. Flavian in Antiocheia. The images are copied from the Lectures on the Acts, printed in the Kievo-Pechorska Lavra in 1642 (Петковић 2002: 404, fig. 3, 4). The composition is framed, with small floral and foliate motifs at the corners. In blue, red, yellow and gold. Within a simple flame ( 150mm 95mm ) with floral motifs in the inner side of each corner. Inscribed: ст҃ы̏ флавїанч рꙋко по҆лага́етъ, стаго і҆ѡа́на зла҇ а҇́то ѹ̋ста́го . въ антио́хїи ⁘

F. 74: the Proscomidy (Picture of the Holy Gifts) and the Chalice with Christ in it, blood running from His wounds. The miniature occupies the upper part of the frame surrounding both the text column and the image
F. 133: Picture of the Holy Plate (diskos) in the lower half of page.
Bands and bars, representing varieties of the Balkan interlaced style

F. 1: A band, 36mm 80mm for the whole field; the pattern is composed of three intersecting “Sassanian” circles; the endings of the stems are foliate, the upper two being very large; between them is centered the Cross with the inscription I҆С҃‚ Х҃Ъ.
F. 2*: a bandof interlaced pattern, 48mm 88mm , with an interlaced Cross with the inscription I҆С҃‚ Х҃Ъ centred on the upper line.
F. 7v: a bar, of parallel stems with rosette-like widenings and repeated half-leave pattern on the upper line. In orange, blye and red, 12mm 88mm
F. 11: Coloured plaited headpiece, similar to the one on f. 2*; in yellow, golden, grey, 43mm 84mm
F. 17: A band, composed of half-circle loops, with foliate endings. In blue, golden, yellow, and red, 14mm 97mm
F. 21: A band ( 14mm 97mm ) of the same kind as that on f. 17
F. 25v: A band, of the same kind as that on f. 17, 14mm 98mm
F. 30v: A band ( 14mm 105mm ) of the same kind as that on f. 17
F. 39: A framed band, 53mm 98mm , with a pattern of a centered human face (“mask”) and interlaced stems. In blue, red, and silver
F. 50: A band of interlaced pattern, 45mm 88mm , with vertically turned endings of the stems; an interlaced Cross centred on the upper line. In blue, golden, and red
F. 51v: A band, of the same kind as that on f. 17. In blue, golden and yellow, with red contour, 18mm 105mm
F. 56: A band, 23mm 105mm , of stems composing fret-pattern, with rosette-like widenings; repeated motif of a half-leave on the upper line, the endings are foliate
F. 58: An arch, with the Cross centred on the upper line, 45mm 88mm
F. 84: A band in silver, blue, yellow, red, simmilar to the one on f. 50, 37mm 88mm
F. 148v: A band, 25mm 105mm , of stems composing a fret-pattern, similar to that on f. 56, only the upper-line stems with the half-leave motif make loops; in blue and red.
F. 38v: A hand holding a bunch of leaves.

Numerous, of geometric type, 25 to 52 mm, painted in red and decorated with foliate branch patterns; in some the decoration is particularly rich, arranged at the basis of the letter; some letters В are enlivened with an eye in the upper bow; some initials have outlined stems, in some the foliate patterns are also coloured with gold and blue
F. 8v: Large initial of neo-Byzantine geometrical style with floral motifs.
F. 10v: Large initial of neo-Byzantine geometrical style in red and blue with floral motifs
F. 11v: Large initial of neo-Byzantine geometrical style with floral motifs in red and blue
F. 13: Large initial of neo-Byzantine geometrical style with floral motifs
F. 16: Large initial of neo-Byzantine geometrical style with floral motifs
F. 35v: Large initial of neo-Byzantine geometrical style with vegetal motifs
F. 49v: Large initial of neo-Byzantine geometrical style with vegetal motifs
F. 50v: Large initial of neo-Byzantine geometrical style with vegetal motifs and and eye
F. 52v: Large initial of neo-Byzantine geometrical style with vegetal motifs
F. 120v: Large initial of neo-Byzantine geometrical style with vegetal motifs
F. 130v: Large initial of neo-Byzantine geometrical style with a rich vegetal motif and an eye motif
F. 145: Large initial of neo-Byzantine geometrical style with a rich vegetal motif
F. 154: Large initial of neo-Byzantine geometrical style with vegetal motifs
F. 1: Initial of neo-Byzantine geometrical style with floral motifs
F. 4v: Initial of neo-Byzantine geometrical style in red, blue and gold with floral motifs.
F. 5: Initial of neo-Byzantine geometrical style with floral motifs
F. 6v: Initial of neo-Byzantine geometrical style with floral motifs
F. 21: Initial of neo-Byzantine geometrical style with an eye

F. 65: Initial of neo-Byzantine geometrical style with vegetal motif.
F. 69v: Initial of neo-Byzantine geometrical style in red blue, richly ornameted.
F. 71: Initial of neo-Byzantine geometrical style in red blue.
F. 78: Initial of neo-Byzantine geometrical style with rich vegetal motifq richly ornamented.
F. 79v: Initial of neo-Byzantine geometrical style.
F. 81:Initial of neo-Byzantine geometrical style with an eye motif.
F. 86:Initial of neo-Byzantine geometrical style with vegetal motif.
F. 87:Initial of neo-Byzantine geometrical style with vegetal motif.
F. 88v: Initial of neo-Byzantine geometrical style with vegetal motif, richly ornamented.
F. 97v: Initial of neo-Byzantine geometrical style with vegetal and motif motif, richly ornamented.
F. 102: Initial of neo-Byzantine geometrical style with vegetal motif.
F. 103: Initial of neo-Byzantine geometrical style with vegetal motif.
F. 104v: Initial of neo-Byzantine geometrical style with vegetal motif.
F. 106v:Initial of neo-Byzantine geometrical style with vegetal motif.
F. 113v:Initial of neo-Byzantine geometrical style with vegetal motif.

F. 124v: Initial of neo-Byzantine geometrical style with vegetal motif, masive stem.
F. 128: Initial of neo-Byzantine geometrical style with vegetal motif.

Numerous of marginal signs depicting blessing hands (f. 123), hands holding a cross (ff. 4, 12v, 23, 23v, 53), a candlestick (ff. 89, 99v, 143v), a book (f. 92), or a crown (ff. 5, 8v, 33, 41, 116v, 122v, 131v). Pictures of the Sun and the Moon in the tables in the end of the MS

bindingDesc.p: Ornamented leather on beveled wooden boards, 230mm x 160 mm; raised cords on the spine; two clasps. Golden tooling. The central piece on the upper cover is a large medallion with the Crucifixion, the corner stamps bear the images of the Evangelists with Greek captions. Small, single rosettes fill in the empty fields. On the lower cover the leather is stamped by a central piece bearing the image of an eagle in foliate frame; the corner stamps are angel’s heads, the rosettes fill in the empty fields. The whole pattern is characteristic for Russian and Ukrainian Gospel bindings of the late 17th and 18th centuries. Obviously, the binding was not intended for this manuscript.

item.quote: Written in Bosnia, in the Servian dialect, A. D. 1706

scriptDesc.p: Semiuncial - a vigorous and clear (4mm line; 5mm interline space) one, with a slight foreword slope, longish, but not extended ascendersand descenders); titles are in simple 'vjaz' (10-12 mm high). each page has a framed with double red lines written area (165x105mm)

msContents.summary: The book is an archbishop's euchologion containing the text of John Chrysostom's liturgy and services for ordination of clergymen, some of which, like those of an exorcist, church-janitor, candleholder etc., are relatively rare. Contains 19 texts

head.foreign: б҃жес҇въ́наа, литѹрь́гїа, и̋же въ с҃тых ѡц҃а на́ше҅го с҃тѣишаго и҆бл҃женнаго а҆рхие҆пс҇кпа константина гра́да нова́го ры́ма и҆вьселѥ́ньскаго па҆трїа́р'ха, і҆ѡан'на злато́ꙋстаго⸫

sampleText.head: Чи̋нь блс҇ви́ти клїри́ка си́ рѣ́чь . причъ́тника въпръвом пос҇трыже́нїи вла́сѡв

msItemStruct.title: Чин за ръкополагане на църковен вратар

sampleText.head: Чинь и̋ блс҇ве́нїе и҆рꙋкоположе́нїе ц҃ръко́вънаго врата́ра:
Чы́нъ и̋ рꙋ̋коположенїе е҆ѯаки́сти си̏ рѣ́чь заклина́телꙗ

msItemStruct.title: Чинопоследование за ръкополагане на църковен четец и псалт

sampleText.head: Чы́н на поставлѥ́нїе чът'ца. и҆ пѣвца
Чы́нь бывае́мыи на пос҇тавлѥ́нїе і҆ пос҇ дїа́кона
Чы́нь на поставлѥ́нїе протопо́па. и҆ли про́тодїа́кона . и҆ли а҆рхидїа́кона
Чы́нь сщ҃ен҇ные и б҃жестъ́вны́е литръ́гїе быва́ѥмые си́це. въ вели́цеи ц҃ркви и҆ въ вьсѣ́хь предѣ́лѣхь е̋ѥ ⸬
Бжествь́наа҇ лїтѹръгїа и̋же въ с҃ты ѡ҆ц҃а на́шего і҆ѡ҆а̋нна зла҆то́ꙋстаго

msItemStruct.title: Указания за вземане на свето причастие

sampleText.rubric: Подоба́ет҇ же и҆ ѡ сем҇ знати.

msItemStruct.title: Молитви разрешителни, четени от архиерей или духовен отец. Молитва разрешителна, 1

sampleText.head: Мл҃тва прощен'на за въса прѣгрѣше́нїа вол'наа и҆ нево́лнаа ю̋же чът҇е а҆рхїереи:
sampleText.incipit: Г҃и і҆се҃ х҃е б҃е на́шь. с҃не и҆ сло́ве б҃а жїваго

msItemStruct.title: Молитви разрешителни, четени от архиерей или духовен отец. Молитва разрешителна, 2

sampleText.head: Мл҃тва втора томѹ̋жд҇е.
sampleText.incipit: Г҃ь премлс҇, да ѹ҆щед҇ри́тъте, г҃ь і҆с҃ х҃с въса́ка проше́нїа бл҃гаа дада́сть тебѣ

msItemStruct.title: Таблица с четивата и гласовете за съботите след Възкресение
Месецослов за цялата година
msItemStruct.note: Gives both fixed and movable feasts from March to February; includes the feastdays of St. John of Rila (19 Oct.), St. Paraskeve (Petka) (14 Oct.), St. Stephen of Dečani (11 Nov.), St. Simeon of Serbia (13 Feb.), and St. Cyril the Apostle of Slavs (14 Feb.)

msItemStruct.title: Колофон
msItemStruct.author: Lazar the Bulgarian
msItemStruct.note: States that the MS was copied in the monastery of Žitomislić

colophon.p: б҃жес҇твъ́наа, литѹрь́гїа, и̋же въ с҃тых҇ ѡц҃а на́ше҅го с҃тѣишаго̏ и҆ бл҃женнаго а҆рхие҆пс҇кпа константина гра́да нова́го ри́ма и҆ вьселѥ́ньскаго па҆трїа́р'ха, і҆ѡанꙿна злато́ꙋстаго ⸫ написа́ се въ с҃тою о҆бы́тел҇ мо҆на́стирь жи҆томис҇лићь храм҇ бл҃гове҆щѣ́нїе прс҇ты́е б҃це, на рѣ́це не҆рѣ́тве ⸫ въ лт҇е ҂з҃сд҃і : а҆ ѿ рожд҇ство хс҇во ҂а҃ѱѕ

msItemStruct.title: Колофон
msItemStruct.author: Lazar the Bulgarian
msItemStruct.note: States that the MS was copied for and belonged to Visarion the mitropolitain of Bosnia and that the book was written by Lazar the Bulgarian in the monastery of Žitomislić during the time of the hegumenos hieromonk Arsenij and Gerasim, mitropolitain of Zahumlje

colophon.p: Сїа́ с҃та́а и҆ б҃жс҇твь́наа литꙋр҇гїа въсео̋сщ҃е́номꙋ, митро́политꙋ, кѵ̈рїю кѵ̈р҇ Висари́онꙋ. да҆бър҇ско́мꙋ и҆ въсеи̏ бо҆сне . съписа́ се въ мона́стирь жи҆томислић҇' при и҆гѹ̋мена кѵ̈ р҇ а҆рсенїю̏ і҆е҆рмона́ха . и҆ при митро́полита за҆хлъми́скаго. кѵр҇ ге҆раси́ма : въ лѣ́то ѿ бы́тїа: ҂з҃сд҃і . ѿ рож҇ ҂аѱ҃ѕ:- и҆ндикто, д҃і. клю́чь слова в҃ . крꙋгь сл'нцꙋ, и҃і : а҆лꙋны̏ г҃і : е̋пахта лѣ́тꙋ. а҃: потрꙋди́х се о̋ се́мъ а҆зь мно́го гѣ́шны̏ и҆ маньши въ чл҃це́хъ ла҆за́ръ бѹ҆гари́нъ ⁘

origin.p: The book was copied in 1706 in Žitomislić Monastery by Lazar the Bulgarian for Visarion, the mitropolitain of Debar and of the whole Bosnia

source.p: Directly catalogued from the original manuscript using the printed catalogue Cleminson 1988: 64

surrogates.p: Microform: Central Library of BAS, MF-10
